SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.h2.jaqu.annotation
Annotation Type One2Many

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface One2Many

Use to set a field for a one to many relationship.

Notes:

  1. Relation and Table must have a primary key, and primary key must be defined before relationship
  2. If using a relation table there is no sense of having the Parent object as a field of the child. Doing so will yield an error!

Note: The generic type is used to infer the other object, used to get the primary key type. In oneToMany, lazyLoading is the default, but eager load can be done. The relationship can be Two sided (can be seen from both objects) or one sided (can be seen from parent only). Also, implementation of the relation can be done by a relation table or by a foreign key relation, both are supported, if no relation table is given a foreign key is assumed.

Author:
Shai Bentin

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.Class<?> childType
          the class type of the related object.
 java.lang.String relationFieldName
          The name of the field in the target object holding the other side of the relationship.
 
Optional Element Summary
 CascadeType cascadeType
          Only Cascade Delete is supported.
 java.lang.Class<?> childPkType
          When using a relationTable, the other side of the relation primary key field should be named here. otherwise null.
 boolean eagerLoad
          Set to true if data should be loaded on object load.
 java.lang.String joinTableName
          the name of the DB table maintaining the relationship.
 java.lang.String myFieldNameInRelation
          Relevant only when using a relation table.
 java.lang.String relationColumnName
          Relevant only when using a relation table.
 

Element Detail

childType

public abstract java.lang.Class<?> childType
the class type of the related object.

relationFieldName

public abstract java.lang.String relationFieldName
The name of the field in the target object holding the other side of the relationship. If null 'this' tableName will be used! Note: In a single sided relationship, without a relationship, a column FK must exist in the child table, even if it does not exist in the object

joinTableName

public abstract java.lang.String joinTableName
the name of the DB table maintaining the relationship. Default no relation table

Default:
""

myFieldNameInRelation

public abstract java.lang.String myFieldNameInRelation
Relevant only when using a relation table. If null then column name will be used, otherwise denotes the name of the column representing 'this' side in the relationship table.

Default:
""

relationColumnName

public abstract java.lang.String relationColumnName
Relevant only when using a relation table. The name of the column representing the other side of the relation. (used in both cases, FK or relation table). Must have value!

Default:
""

childPkType

public abstract java.lang.Class<?> childPkType
When using a relationTable, the other side of the relation primary key field should be named here. otherwise null.

Default:
java.lang.Object.class

eagerLoad

public abstract boolean eagerLoad
Set to true if data should be loaded on object load. Default false

Default:
false

cascadeType

public abstract CascadeType cascadeType
Only Cascade Delete is supported. Default is CascadeType.NONE, which means the related objects are not deleted when parent is deleted.

Default:
org.h2.jaqu.CascadeType.NONE
